definition: to finish class/to get out of class
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Class will be over in ten minutes.
No one’s half as nerdy as I am. The bell rang in thirty seconds, precisely what her watch said.
sentences.chinese: 三十秒后下课铃响了，跟她的表分秒不差。

sentences.english: Students went out of the clASsroom one by one AS soon AS the bell rang.
sentences.chinese: 下课铃一响，学生们一个个从教室里走出来。

sentences.english: When the bell rang, the pupils ran helter-skelter out of the door.
sentences.chinese: 下课铃响时，学生们蜂拥冲出门去。

sentences.english: What we've got to turn to next time, then, is the question, what else might it be? Okay.
sentences.chinese: 下次我们要探讨的问题是，还会是什么？，下课。

sentences.english: Our teacher instructed that we(should) hand in our papers after class.
sentences.chinese: 老师命令我们下课后把试卷交上去。

sentences.english: Why did the recess bell ring 20 minutes early?
sentences.chinese: 为什么下课铃提前20分钟就响了？

sentences.english: The discussion became so lively that no one wanted to stop when the bell rang.
sentences.chinese: 讨论十分活跃，下课铃响了，大家还不愿停下来。

sentences.english: Please remember to say thank you to your coach after every lesson.
sentences.chinese: 每节课下课时，请记得跟你的教练说谢谢。

sentences.english: The teacher let that boy wait behind after class.
sentences.chinese: 老师让那个男孩子下课后留下来。

sentences.english: After the class, all the students charged into the playground.
sentences.chinese: 下课后所有孩子都冲到了操场上。

sentences.english: Just then the bell rings for recess.
sentences.chinese: 就在这时下课休息的铃声突然响了。

sentences.english: Boys and girls, hand in your exercise books after class.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们，下课后把练习本交上来。

sentences.english: We handed in our exams at the last minute of the class.
sentences.chinese: 在下课的最后时刻，我们交了考试卷。

sentences.english: Okay.I think our time is up.
Now, class is over, they are not in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 现在是下课时间，怎么在教室看不见他们呢？

definition: to teach/to be a teacher/to train/to coach
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
foreign teacher (abbr. for 外國教師|外国教师)/greenhorn/novice/amateurish/religion other than Buddhism (term used by Buddhists)
to drag out a lesson/to insist on extending class after the bell
to fire/to sack/to dismiss/to terminate employment
to dismiss students at the end of the school day
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
sporting coach/military drill master (in Song times)
